oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1939-10-14 - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 2 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from October 14, 1939. Featuring David Stone (announcer), George D. Hay (host), and performers Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys, Uncle Dave Macon and son Dorris Macon, George Wilkerson and his Fruit Jar Drinkers, DeFord Bailey, and Rachel Veach and Bashful Brother Oswald. First NBC broadcast, held at War Memorial Auditorium, Nashville, TN.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Uncle Dave Macon; George Wilkerson; Fruit Jar Drinkers; DeFord Bailey; Rachel Veach; Bashful Brother Oswald; Roy Acuff; Smoky Mountain Boys
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: [continued from part 1; TR000001] / (0:00) Uncle Dave Macon performs "Nobody's Darling But Mine" [incomplete] [continued from part 1] / (0:40) George D. Hay introduces George Wilkerson and his Fruit Jar Drinkers / (0:50) George Wilkerson and his Fruit Jar Drinkers perform "Old Joe Clark" / (2:09) George D. Hay introduces DeFord Bailey / (2:20) DeFord Bailey performs "Fox Chase" / (3:26) David Stone reads telegrams from Republic Productions Inc. and W. Lee O'Daniel / (4:20) George D. Hay reads telegrams from Sgt. Alvin C. York and Ky. Senator Albert B. Chandler / (5:18) George D. Hay introduces Rachel Veach and Bashful Brother Oswald / (5:29) Rachel Veach and Bashful Brother Oswald perform "John Henry" / (7:20) George D. Hay introduces the Smoky Mountain Boys / (7:32) Roy Acuff and his Smoky Mountain Boys perform "Old Rattler" / (8:56) George D. Hay introduces Uncle Dave Macon / (9:05) Uncle Dave Macon performs "Way Out On The Mountain" / (10:13) George D. Hay introduces DeFord Bailey / (10:23) DeFord Bailey performs "Evening Prayer Blues" / (11:12) DeFord Bailey performs "Memphis Blues" / (12:30) David Stone announces a Prince Albert commercial / (13:27) Closing theme / (13:48) George D. Hay and David Stone announce the closing statements
